newsitem.title: USA: New York's Agway Inc recalls frozen strawberries.
newsitem.headline: New York's Agway Inc recalls frozen strawberries.

text.p: Agricultural cooperative Agway Inc said it was voluntarily recalling 779 containers of frozen strawberries from its stores after learning they came from a company which shipped berries associated with a Hepatitis A virus outbreak.

Agway said it began contacting its retail stores and customers on Thursday after learning from its supplier that the 30-pound containers of strawberries were shipped by Epitope Inc's Andrew and Williamson Sales Co.

Earlier in the week, Epitope said Andrew and Williamson voluntarily recalled frozen sliced strawberries shipped to distributors because they were associated with a Hepatitis A outbreak in some Michigan schools.
The Syracuse-based cooperative said the recall was precautionary and was not requested by regulators.

Customers who bought sliced frozen strawberries in 30-pound containers through Agway's frozen food order program since July 1996 were asked to return the product for a full refund, the cooperative said.
"We are taking this voluntary action in the interest of our customers' well-being and to preserve the trust they've placed in Agway," Donald Schalk, vice president of Agway Retail Services, said.
When ordering the strawberries, Agway said it had specified the product be grown within the United States.
A confirmation order from its supplier related to this shipment said the berries were "California sliced strawberries."
